sen.j: 新宮 行朝（しんぐう ゆきとも）は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Yukitomo SHINGU is a busho (Japanese military commander) from the Sengoku period.
Yukitomo SHINGU was a busho (Japanese military commander) of the Sengoku period.
Yukitomo SHINGU was a busho (Japanese military commander) of the Sengoku period.
Original name is Ujihiro HORIUCHI.
His original name was Ujihiro HORIUCHI.
sen.cmt: Original name is → original name was
sen.e: His original name was Ujihiro HORIUCHI.

sen.j: 紀伊国新宮城堀内氏善の嫡男（六男、または弟とも）。
sen.e: He is the legitimate son of Ujiyoshi HORIUCHI of Shingu-jo Castle in Kii Province (said to be the sixth son, or the brother).
He was a legitimate son of Ujiyoshi HORIUCHI of Shingu-jo Castle in Kii Province (said to be Ujiyoshi's sixth son or younger brother).
sen.cmt: the legitimate son → a legitimate sonsaid to be the sixth son, or the brother) → (said to be Ujiyoshi's sixth son or younger brother)
sen.e: He was a legitimate son of Ujiyoshi HORIUCHI of Shingu-jo Castle in Kii Province (said to be Ujiyoshi's sixth son or younger brother).
Main name is Seiwa-Genji clan.
His main name was Seiwa-Genji clan.
sen.cmt: Main name is → His main name was
sen.e: His main name was Seiwa-Genji clan.

sen.j: 家系は清和源氏のひとつ、河内源氏の系統といい、源義家の二代後の源為義の十男の源行家を祖とする。
sen.e: The family line is one of Seiwa-Genji, called the lineage of Kawauchi-Genji, and the founder is the MINAMOTO no Yukiie who was the tenth son of MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi, second generation after MINAMOTO no Yoshiie.

His family line was one of Seiwa-Genji, called the lineage of Kawauchi-Genji, and the founder was the MINAMOTO no Yukiie who was the tenth son of MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi, the second- generation successor of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie's.

His family line was one of the Seiwa-Genji lines, called the lineage of Kawauchi-Genji, and the founder was MINAMOTO no Yukiie, who was the tenth son of MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi, the second-generation successor of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie's.

sen.j: 生家である熊野新宮城堀内家と其の一族は寛政重修諸家譜に詳しい。
sen.e: Horiuchi family in Kumano Shingu Castle which is the birth place and this family is very specific about Kansei choshu shokafu (Kansei Continued Lineage of the Edo bakufu).
The lineage of Horiuchi family in Kumano Shingu Castle, his birth place and its clans are detailed in Kansei choshu shokafu (Kansei Continued Lineage of the Edo bakufu).
The lineage of the Horiuchi family in Kumano Shingu-jo Castle, his birth place, and its clans are detailed in Kansei choshu shokafu (Kansei Continued Lineage of the Edo bakufu).
Juryomei (honorary titles) is Wakasa Province.
His juryomei (honorary titles) was Wakasa Province.
His juryomei (honorary titles) was Wakasa Province.

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉が天下を統一する前後からその家臣となり、関ヶ原の戦いでは西軍に属して改易、没落した。
sen.e: He became a vassal around the time when Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI unified the country, and in the Battle of Sekigahara, he joined the Western army, and lost.
He became a vassal around the time when Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI unified the country, and in the Battle of Sekigahara, he joined the Western army, and lost.
He became a vassal around the time when Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI unified the country, and in the Battle of Sekigahara, he joined the Western army, and lost.

sen.j: 浅野幸長が紀伊国和歌山城に封ぜられると、行朝は500石で召し抱えられたが、待遇に不満をおぼえて出奔した。
sen.e: When Yoshinaga ASANO was suppressed in Wakayama-jo Castle in Kii Province, Yukitomo was given 500 koku, but was dissatisfied with this reward, and resigned.
When Yoshinaga ASANO was suppressed in Wakayama-jo Castle in Kii Province, Yukitomo was given 500 koku, but was dissatisfied with this reward, and resigned.
When Yoshinaga ASANO was suppressed in Wakayama-jo Castle in Kii Province, Yukitomo was given 500 koku, but was dissatisfied with this reward, and resigned.

sen.j: 大坂の役では、旧領回復のため300人を率いて大野治房の寄騎となり、さらに伊東長次の部隊に属した。
sen.e: In the Siege of Osaka, he lead 300 men for the restoration of the former territory and became a Yoriki (lower ranked samurai) of Harufusa ONO, and also joined the troop of Nagatsugu ITO.
In the Siege of Osaka, he lead 300 men for the restoration of the former territory and became a Yoriki (lower ranked samurai) of Harufusa ONO, and also joined the troop of Nagatsugu ITO.
In the Siege of Osaka, he lead 300 men for the restoration of the former territory and became a Yoriki (lower ranked samurai) of Harufusa ONO, and also joined the troop of Nagatsugu ITO.

sen.j: 大坂夏の陣の天王寺・岡山の戦いなどで大いに活躍し、紀州一揆を煽動することによって旧主浅野氏を混乱させている。
sen.e: He gave a distinguished war service in the Battle of Tenoji-Temple, Okayama in the Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka), and by stiring up the uprise of Kishu Province, he creates a chaos for the former lord, Asano clan.

He gave distinguished service in the Battle of Tenoji-Temple, Okayama in the Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka), and by stirring up the uprise of Kishu Province, he created a chaos for the former lord, Asano clan.

He gave distinguished service in the Battle of Tenoji-Temple, Okayama in the Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka), and by stirring up the uprise of Kishu Province, he created a chaos for the former lord, Asano clan.

sen.j: 大坂城が落城すると一旦逃れたものの、大和国で松倉重政軍に捕らえられて捕虜となってしまう。
sen.e: When Osaka Castle fell, although he was able to escape once, he gets caught by the troop of Shigemasa MATSUKURA in Yamato Province, and becomes a captive.
When Osaka Castle fell, although he managed to escape once, he was caught by the troop of Shigemasa MATSUKURA in Yamato Province, and was held a captive.
When Osaka-jo Castle fell, although he managed to escape once, he was caught by Shigemasa MATSUKURA's troops in Yamato Province, and was held captive.

sen.j: その後、三弟の堀内氏久（七弟、または甥とも）の千姫救出の功により赦免され、伊勢国津藩藤堂高虎の家臣となったという。
sen.e: Then he gets saved by the Senhime of Ujihisa HORIUCHI, the third youngest brother, and becomes a vassal for Takatora TODO of the Tsu Domain in Ise Province.
Then he was pardoned for his third youngest brother, Ujihisa HORIUCHI saving Senhime and became a vassal for Takatora TODO of the Tsu Domain in Ise Province.
Then he was pardoned for his third youngest brother, Ujihisa HORIUCHI, saving Senhime and became a vassal of Takatora TODO of the Tsu Domain in Ise Province.

sen.j: また、異説には大和国竜田藩片桐氏に70石で仕えたとも伝わる。
sen.e: Also, another story that tells he served for Katagiri clan of Tatsuta Domain in Yamato Province in 70 koku.
A heresy says that he served for Katagiri clan of Tatsuta Domain in Yamato Province in 70 koku.
A different view says that he served for the Katagiri clan of Tatsuta Domain in Yamato Province for 70 koku.
